description.narrative: Stöd till UNODC:s program som syftar till att relevanta myndigheter, aktörer inom civilsamhälle och privat näringsliv i Myanmar med ökad effektivitet förhindrar, ökar medvetenheten om, upptäcker, utreder och åtalar korruption.
Support for UNODC's programs aimed at relevant authorities in Myanmar to more effectively prevent, raise awareness, detect, investigate and prosecute corruption.

participating-org.narrative: UNODC/United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime
UNODC/United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime

tag.narrative: 16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.4 - By 2030, significantly reduce illicit financial and arms flows, strengthen the recovery and return of stolen assets and combat all forms of organized crime.
16.4 - Till 2030 avsevärt minska de olagliga finansiella flödena och vapenflödena, öka möjligheterna att återvinna och återfå stulna tillgångar samt bekämpa alla former av organiserad brottslighet.
16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The 2018 narrative report includes a number of results achieved during 2018; some of them on outcome level and a number of them on activitity level. Compared to last year's report, this report gives a better picture about what the UNODC programme has contributed to. Some gender-related activities are mentioned, which is also an improvement compared to last year. The gender-related work is expected to be strengthened during 2019. Training of the field staff of the UNODC Myanmar Sustainable Livelihoods and Development Programme on conflict sensitivity, as well as training of the Anti-Corruption Unit, is mentioned in the report. The main results reported are that a number of recommendations from the first UNCAC review were integrated in the fourth amendment of the Anti-Corruption Law that was promulgated by the President in June 2018. Integration of the recommendations can be derived from UNODC's advice and support to the Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC). Also, the ACC 2018-2021 strategic plan for anti-corruption reform was announced in September. Under the new chairmanship, the ACC's determination against corruption has led to investigation and prosecution of government officials, including high-ranking ones, and representatives of the judiciary, attorney general office, regional and local administration, police force and customs department. During 2018, UNODC has provided a number of training workshops for capacity building with a wide range of institutions and partners, including the ACC. UNODC also assisted ACC in developing and publishing 40 000 copies of the teacher's handbook on "Education Program for promoting Integrity" (Primary Level), to promote integrity and anti-corruption awareness from a young age.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
